Introduction.Purpose: This document outlines the use cases for TogglAssistant to guide feature development and ensure the program meets user needs.
Introduction.Scope: The document describes user actions and success conditions for core functionalities.

UseCases.Title: Listing and Selecting Entries
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to view a list of existing time entries and select one for further actions such as editing or deletion.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: A list of entries is displayed, and the user can successfully select an entry for the desired action.

UseCases.Title: Adding a New Time Entry
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to create a new time entry for a task with specific details such as project, duration, and tags.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: A new time entry is created in Toggl Track with the provided details.

UseCases.Title: Editing an Existing Time Entry
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to update details of an existing time entry, such as its description, project, or tags.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: The time entry is updated in Toggl Track with the modified details.

UseCases.Title: Deleting a Time Entry
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to remove a specific time entry from Toggl Track.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: The time entry is successfully deleted from Toggl Track.

UseCases.Title: Resolving Overlapping Time Entries
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to identify and fix overlapping time entries to ensure accurate tracking.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: All overlapping time entries are resolved without losing relevant information.

UseCases.Title: Detecting Untracked Time
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to identify periods where no time entries exist.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: Untracked periods are highlighted for review or corrected with new entries.

UseCases.Title: Unifying Activity Descriptions
UseCases.Intent: The user wants to merge similar activity descriptions into a single unified label.
UseCases.SuccessCondition: Duplicate descriptions are consolidated without losing tracking details.
